document_data.name: Merchants' Ward
document_data.mainbody: The '''Merchants' Ward''' of [[Port Nyanzaru]], [[Chult]] was home both to many temples and to the grand villa estates of the city's [[merchant princes (Port Nyanzaru)|merchant princes]]. As such, it was considered the city's upper-class district.
document_data.Description:
The Merchants' Ward comprised the western half of the walled portion of Port Nyanzaru, abutting the [[Port Nyanzaru/Harbor Ward|Harbor Ward]] to the east. The southern portion of the ward was an open space dominated by the [[Grand Souk]], a huge covered marketplace.{{Cite adventurers league/Peril at the Port|14}} Much of the rest of the Merchants' Ward was built on and around two steep hills: [[Temple Hill (Port Nyanzaru)|Temple Hill]] to the north and [[Throne Hill]] in the center if the ward. A wide stone bridge atop arched columns connected the tops of these two hills, while a second bridge spanned above the Grand Souk to connect the hilltop to the slopes of the southern mountain overlooking the city, where several merchant princes' villas were located. Access to these hilltops was restricted by walls and gates.

The ward was characterized by decorative banners and elaborate stonework.{{Cite adventurers league/A City on the Edge|6}}

Notable Locations.Landmarks: :;[[Goldenthrone]]: This magnificent palace served as the meeting place and audience chamber for the merchant princes of Port Nyanzaru. It was situated atop Throne Hill.
Notable Locations.Markets:
:;[[Grand Souk]]: This bustling emporium was one of the three great mercantile centers of the city.
:;[[Jewel Market]]: A more exclusive twin of the Grand Souk where Chultan [[gemstone]]s were bought and sold. It sat at the base of Throne Hill.
Notable Locations.Temples:
:;[[Temple of Gond (Port Nyanzaru)|Temple of Gond]]: The house of the Wonderbringer was popular among the city's artisans, crafters and engineers. It sat at the base of Temple Hill.
:;[[Temple of Savras (Port Nyanzaru)|Temple of Savras]]: This holy house of [[Savras]] was perhaps the most magnificent building in all of Port Nyanzaru. It sat at the top of Temple Hill.
:;[[Temple of Sune (Port Nyanzaru)|Temple of Sune]]: Located on a small islet off the coast, this holy house was only accessible on foot by means of an elevated stone bridge from Temple Hill.

document_data.Inhabitants: Despite its name, most merchants in Port Nyanzaru could not afford to live in the Merchants' Ward (and instead made their homes in the [[Port Nyanzaru/Market Ward|Market Ward]]). Instead, the Merchants' Ward was home to the city's wealthiest citizens.{{Cite adventurers league/Peril at the Port|12}}
